Text: @agarwal me too! and gin isn't my #1 - but Coqueta...mmmm!

@DashlaneSupport @dashlane The dashlane guys ROCK!!! Custom build (for now) and all is well! very happy to see great customer support!!

Beware those thinking about moving to @dashlane. It crashes consistently on iOS 9.2 - at least for me. @DashlaneSupport working on it.

So many smart people on both sides of #netneutrality. For my part, glad the robber barons were defeated. http://t.co/1nmU4K7dTm

@MostafaSorkhabi hi! I've forwarded your tweet to the hiring company. Thanks!
One of my companies is looking for an mobile engineer to join the team. Well funded, growing fast, message me for details.
@adamhuda heya adam - wondering if I might reconnect - best coordinates for you?
@EvanHahn =begin and =end
@westcoastbill the pleasure is/was/always is mine, sir!  Let's do more.  So many Pinots, so little time ;-)
RT @EvanHahn: Wrote my first Backbone.js app a few days ago. This is what it looked like. http://t.co/NLGqi0mT
Congrats to all my friends at #proofpoint, now nasdaq:PFPT!  Great company, wonderful people.  Special props to GS, MdP and AK.
@Proofpoint_Inc is positioned in Leaders Quadrant of 2011 Gartner MQ for Secure Email Gateways. Read it here: bit.ly/magic-quadrant!
@dreamhost major fail.  Once a month whether they need it or not...
Chillin with @demetrimartin73 at the Wiltern LA... Show starts rsn...
Want to be really scare the younger trick-or-treaters this Halloween?  Dress up like the deficit.
Obama visits our 'hood and all I got was his motorcade video.  Now I know how he saved the auto industry... http://t.co/YlruG87
#MotionX Share: SYD-SFO http://bit.ly/bHPnxv
#MotionX Share: Back at the marina :-( http://bit.ly/aKmQBg
#MotionX Share: Anchored at beautiful Nara inlet for the night! http://bit.ly/ctzEKi
#MotionX Share:  http://bit.ly/c5ZNX8
Virgin blue has massive, country-wide IT failure!  1,200 people waiting to check in at SYD...
Sydney is stunning.  I had forgotten.
UA863 diverted to HNL due to passenger medical emergency. Back en route to SYD soon, we hope.  Wishing the best for our fellow passenger...
New cisco router now getting > 41mbps down, 14mbps up!  WOOT!!  Time to retire the old Netgear FVX538 which couldn't keep up...
I'm liking www.sproutcore.com, mostly because Cappuccino's Objective-J seems like a detour.  Anyone else using either?
Busy week coming up working with the Inventures portfolio then off to Australia for 11d bare-boating the Whitsundays w friends! woot!
@RememberTheMilk quite flaky still?  Many requests failing/taking very long time (20seconds).  Anyone else?
I'm so proud of you-know-who...  My cup runneth over.
Enjoying the last bit of summer at hale ohia with da family.  Wish you were all here.
Quick stop (72hr) in Bay Area - now back on a plane - feel like I'm living Up In The Air.
Off the net until 8/9.  Withdrawal symptoms may be debilitating. You can reach me at http://goo.gl/maps/1mJq  ;-)
The new iPhone 4 case is just .... Magical! It is the best case we've ever made. Beautiful!
off to NYC for the weekend.  Tix to American Idiot and other touristic pleasures.  Stage or Carnegie... that is the question.
Back on Kafka airlines (island air) hopping over to the valley isle.
Farher's day on Hanalei Bay - perfection on all known levels.   http://yfrog.com/0rs9wej
A delightful hour on Kafka Airlines - where futility and despair are in the air.
AT&T - bad company or worst-ever company?  http://bit.ly/cV83s5.  And besides, the mIcrocrell has to be rebooted weekly to function!
Set up an AT&T MicroCell at chez hahn. I now get to pay AT&T for the privilege of routing my own calls over my own broadband!  Yeah!!
Lovin' my new ride - http://bit.ly/cQv7u0.  Replacing my ancient bike (whose frame was made from stone by the Sumarians!).  Thx @lisbonne.
Installing Ubuntu 10.04 during a board meeting.  Bad, bad Eric.  But the installer doesn't ask questions so I'm rapt w/ attention - promise!
RT @tyralion: http://whois.domaintools.com/rubyonrails.org  WTF? #rubyonrails #rails
Not to be un-PC, but I wish a little of that global warming would visit Hale Ohia.  Freezing to death here in paradise!  OGG-OAK Sat.
TechCrunch - Apparently, Mark Zuckerberg Still Writes Code http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/Techcrunch/~3/uiLIw6P7ivw/
RT @EvanHahn: Dear world: I am officially attending the University of Michigan. Love, Evan
Survey: would you rather hire a CS grad from University of Michigan or University of Washington?  All [constructive] commentary welcome!
1E6 thx to all for the bday props!  Special thx to my wonderful F&F who went all out.  You are the best!  Partying now moves to Sonoma!
Just finished and recommend Churchill by Paul Johnson http://amzn.com/0670021059 - I want to read more about the Great War now.
www.virtuoz.com board today (so cool!).  Very excited about hearing Dave Eggers tomorrow at City Arts & Lectures!  AYT?
off the grid until 7-Mar - satphone only.
Back from Badger Pass w/ Jeremy.  Skiing in short sleeves, 65 degree sun was a blast!  Yosemite was beautiful & empty.  +1 this fo shizzle.
Day at U Mich - go blue!  Now suffering once again the wrath of delta airlines - gate bait en route DTW-STL...
iPad: I-Ponder-And-Despair. Why would I want a proprietary computer with control freak puppetmaster?  WTF?  What am I missing?
@eddieizzard killed in Oakland last night - floor row 5 - awesome, awesome, awseome (thanks, ECH!)
Coding day yesterday... first in a long, long time.  I definitely need to do more of this...
The RNC just sent me a "14th District Census" to fill out.  Ooooh, I'm going to have fun with this.... (hint: I'm not a Republican...)
Just re-read Deadeye Dick (doing a homegrown Vonnegut retrospective) which was particularly sobering given the many references to Haiti.
we just installed 50mbps (15mbps up) service at the office.  In 1980, we installed 50kbps trunks as the arpanet BACKBONE!
Just dumped DirecTV for Tivo-based Comcast!  I am so glad to be off DTV's PVR , or la boîte de merde as we called it at Chez Hahn.
I love psychosis as much as the next guy, but "Weekends at Bellvue"  alas, disappoints  http://bit.ly/6xhGmK http://bit.ly/4ZLfYO
this is why I sail: http://bit.ly/5k2NOd
spent a week sailing in 30kt winds and horizontal rain.  My friends and family were troopers, but every is glad to be dry at last!
on a boat until 1/2/10
Avatar doth rock vigorously.  I couldn't say it is quite as good as Star Wars or Indiana Jones premiers, but darn good nonetheless.
mind-numbing busitude of late:  holiday stuff, corp FYE dealings, family, shopping.  The true meaning of the holidays is.... exhaustion :-)
why can't my Bluetooth phone be my  car "key"?  Why do I need a proprietary key fob?  what am I missing?
@ericvishria sneaky sneaky!
is amazed she stayed with me for lo these 27 years.  An indictment of her otherwise good judgement.  Going to Coi/SF tonight to celebrate.
I thought I knew the limits of American merchandizing.  I was wrong.  Very, very wrong. http://tweetphoto.com/5739079
is back in Palo Alto and noticing the 45 degrees of ambient outside temperature difference from last week.  Was that frost!!??
@megwaiteclayton  -- Westchester County?  West Hollywood?
really enjoyed The Sex Lives of Cannibals: Adrift in the Equatorial Pacific (http://bit.ly/4App7A) - highly recommended!
at OGG picking up my family from the mainland!
Playing with treetop - very cool recursive descent parser for ruby - expecting greatness rsn :-)
is anyone reading more/faster via Kindle?  I seem to be going through books faster than grits through a pig [Barksdale]
is at the beach for a few days.  Programmer's paradise: ocean, sun, mangoes, dual-homed broadband, outdoor-readable lappy...
is soaked with beer, courtesy a clumsy UAL flight attendant.  Worst part: beer wasn't even mine - was guy sitting next to me.
Great lunch with bill lee - he's the first entrepreneur I backed and remains a most wonderful fellow.  Reminds me why I love my job so...
Tuesday is webrat (http://github.com/brynary/webrat) day!  I think I'm going to ditch all old-style controller spec... bad idea?
I have 2 hrs between mtngs today and I promise to work on one or two of those "killer features" I've been dreaming of.
From mild autism to raging schizophrenia - my current reads seem somehow thematic: P.A.M. Dirac, now P.K. Dick ("Ubik").  Enjoyable both.
anyone want a HP4050N (n=networked) laser in great condition (except for duplexer)?  Let me know!  Preferences for non-profit or startup.
Today: restful-auth -> authlogic, homegrown -> icalendar gems.  Wow, Outlook's icalendar support is terrible (brittle, down-rev, etc.)
made it through "supervising" 40 rowdy teenagers, partying 'til the wee hours.  And no police action - victory!
Did 1,000 dishes from last night's party - the set up a win7 machine for Nina - now going to Hyde Park for a well-deserved stroll!
in Maida Vale with Nina who is throwing a party in my honor tonight - very embarrassing, but am looking forward to meeting her friends.
Exciting full throttle approach abort at 1200' LHR - into the air, junior birdmen!
finsihed great board meeting at Virtuoz - going to tour their new space on rue Mogador
great dinner at  http://bit.ly/2iEdAr last night - today at virtuoz Paris for board meeting.  trip.win? # => true
at cloudy Heathrow, waiting for onward flt to Paris.
is SFO-LHR-CDG-dinner @ http://bit.ly/2iEdAr
is very, very happy with authlogic. restful_auth now seems soooo 2008. Must finish integration before Europe trip on wednesay.
is back from launch attempt of hydrogen rockets with J.  Some technical difficulties ensued, but spirits high.
Really enjoying "The Strangest Man" - biography of P.A.M. Dirac. Cameos by young Heisenberg, Born, Oppy. http://bit.ly/QNmEY
60mph winds @ 2am expected.  Locusts to follow?
just saved a few lines of haml with http://bit.ly/saA0W (yes, I know tables == bad).
is using a dinghy repair kit to patch a ripped pool cover.  I love the smell of toluene in the morning - its the smell of... victory
today: meetings.each { |meeting| meeting.prepare; meeting.attend } - but some very exciting ones in the mix.
was just without power for a few hours.  It was an illuminating experience, albeit experienced in darkness.
is very embarrassed by the totally-stale ingroup.com site.  I have a rails replacement for the static html - just need some time to go live!
is back in even sunnier Palo Alto!
is in sunny (!) Seattle.
Just learned about activerecord aggregations - yet another nicety in rails.  Could you do this in a staticly-typed language?  Would be sweet
Fantastically busy this week - where does work come from?  Maybe a manifestation of our subconscious?  http://bit.ly/FdZcc
Great wknd w/ f & f - abt 7,000 calories worth.  At least I won't have to worry about scurvey, beriberi, xerophthalmia and rickets.
Just learned WAY more about sewage ejectors then he ever wanted to.  For example, CH4(g) + 2O2(g) → CO2(g) + 2H2O(l) + 890 kJ/mol. kaboom!
at Virtuoz today:  AI-based virtual agents handling >60% of inbound customer service queries at our biggest customer... "I'm sorry Dave..."
Day 'o coding! Client now massively ajax'ed and jquery'ed.  I'm again reminded how painful html+css+js+http is - hey: no pain, no gain.
is planning to refactor a lot of haml and js today, "work" permitting.
is embarrassed by US "health care".  AM now VERY pro universal coverage, but am no longer clinging to single-payer.  http://bit.ly/104gIK
Full day at the office.  Reward for (hopefully) finishing meetings/emails/conf calls early: a tiny bit 'o coding late in the day...
Eric vs. 2 ceviches: shrimp: winner!  plantain: somehow better when my Tico friends make it... but I have not even begun to fight!
Playing with his Patacones, Chicharrones, Cho Cho, Fu Fu and limones.  News to follow.
Fabulous and occasionally productive day with jQuery/ajax.  Maybe this internet thing will catch on after all...
Fully back from summer wall-to-wall time w/ some great new companies.  Everything is hoppin' and that's a good thing, indeed.
last full day on Maui - waaaaahhhhhhh.  But looking forward to getting back to work, friends, home too.
is back from the Adriatic (Italy, Croatia. Albania, Montenegro, Greece).  Highly recommended.
3 of 3 = last day in Venice (sad face), but Ravenna is tomorrow (happy face).
Just landed in Venezia - hot hot hor but bellissima
Landed in Frankfurt - the 777 isn't bad, but UA first is 0.8 of BA club world imho...  On to Venezia in 1h15!
is exiting stage right: Venice, Ravenna, Otranto, Corfu, Sarande, Split, Dubrovnik w/ B&E (OMG! BFF!) Back 8/9.  Coding: maybe...
is back from 2 weeks volunteering in rural Costa Rica w/ @evanahn - now stuck at DFW overnight due AA woes.  Shocking contrasts abound...
is packed!: 2 weeks doing volunteer construction with Evan in Central America - http://globalvolunteers.org/ - offline til 11-Jul.
is prepping for 'horizontal weather' - in central america building houses with Evan.  Satphone + toilet paper = glamour!
is Father's Day'ing.  At the beach.  With my boys.  And dog.  (betterp) => nil.
really enjoyed Vertical Challenge - the 100% helicopter air show @ Hiller.  Helicopter in pidgin: Bigpella mixmix belong jesus christ (true)
is at the VirtuOz (www.virtuoz.com) board meeting today - the SF flavor, not the Paris flavor (not that I'm complaining mind you...)
Hey, the US and Iran have a lot in common: we both will have suffered at the hands of a two-term, limbic-brain despot leader.
watching rabbits scurry across the Palo Alto runway in defiance of the air traffic.  In an altercation, smart money's on the plane...
knee deep in device drivers.  Tell me again: why do I always think "oh, this upgrade will go well"
is thinking about Airlie Beach and sailing the Whitsundays this winter.  Was last there 20 years ago and have a scar from Nara to prove it!
is anniversarying with his bride.
Just to lay rumors to rest... YES: I used to own bing.com.  NO: I had nothing to do with the new (Microsoft) bing.com.  I'm just sayin...
... and Bret.   I guess Mel wins.
... oh, that would be Jermaine.  Kiwi-style.
Brett and Germaine forever.  I am their biggest fan (sorry, Mel...)
Is queued in the mega flight of the conchords line!  Can't wait to see Brett+Germaine live tho!
Never fully appreciated time zone arithmetic until now.  Coding for Ring World would be oh so much easier!
continues to be very happy about reposado in palo alto - http://www.reposadorestaurant.com/ - guacamole == manna
is feeling supermuch better than yesterday, although that's only about as healthy as passing the fed's bank stress test.
acts_as_state_machine, baby!  Ruby domain-specific-language-fu or the Tower of Babel? (and we all know how that turned out...)
enjoying dinner al fresco with da posse
... that's a deal-breaker, ladies
is pondering BackgrounDrb, background-fu, Daemons and plain old script/runner+cron - anyone: advice for the newb?
Just saw 'earth' (Disney).  Cute animals killing one another while the planet slowly rots away in the background. What's not to like?
FF3.5B4 - wow! (NB: you'll also need Firebug Alpha 1.4 if you're a developer...)
Arlen Specter, I love you: http://tinyurl.com/c6f4xm
just upgraded one of his dev machines to Windows 7 and "liking" it (rather, it seems to suck less than Vista by a wide mile).
is at the Computer History Museum board of trustee's meeting this afternoon  http://www.computerhistory.org/
My mother told me "if you have nothing nice to say, then say nothing."  About Dick Chaney: I have nothing to say.
btw, here's what a jet engine starter motor looks/sounds like: http://tinyurl.com/c6ynur
"I'm sorry ladies and gentleman, but our port engine #1 starter motor is not disengaging." - but it all had a happy (and safe) ending.
in row 20 BA285 LHR-SFO - I think I've endowed this chair on BA.  Landing in +11hrs
is back at Paris' hotel Scribe (9eme) after a long, long day.  But wait!  It starts again tomorrow at 5am!  Happy happy joy joy.
is in Paris in meetings today - flying home tomorrow (Tuesday).
is talking to the London police!  A thug on the mews was threatening each house and then caroling at the top of his lungs.  Meth Dickens?
is wagamama'ing.
is jetlagged in Maida Vale
SFO-LHR on BA286 - party at 20-K?
going to sneak out of the office later to check out sailboats - http://www.strictlysail.com/shows/pacific.asp
is getting ready for his trip to London+Paris on Friday
just checked in a huge changeset to xenon - 44 files, >600 lines...Yep, it all works fine - trust me :-) - off to cook dinner!
@EvanHahn feel better
is cooking dinner reluctantly.
is (sadly) going to Monsters vs. Aliens (3D)
